EditDataFormTemplateSpec.Name: Declined EFT Tab Edit Data Form
EditDataFormTemplateSpec.Description: Edit eft decline batch sponsor data.
EditDataFormTemplateSpec.Author: Memphis Sellers

SaveImplementation.common:CreateProcedureSQL:
create procedure dbo.USR_USP_DATAFORMTEMPLATE_EDIT_EFTDECLINEBATCH_SPONSOR ( @ID uniqueidentifier, @CHANGEAGENTID uniqueidentifier = null, @CARDHOLDERNAME nvarchar(255), --@BATCHDATE date, @DECLINEREASON nvarchar(max), @CARDNUMBER nvarchar(4), @CARDEXPIRATION nvarchar(8), @ACCOUNTINFO nvarchar(4000), @BATCHTYPE nvarchar(20) --@BATCHNUMBER nvarchar(100), --@CHILDINFO nvarchar(100), --@REVENUELOOKUPID nvarchar(100) ) as
set nocount on;
if @CHANGEAGENTID is null exec dbo.USP_CHANGEAGENT_GETORCREATECHANGEAGENT @CHANGEAGENTID output
declare @CURRENTDATE datetime set @CURRENTDATE = getdate()
begin try -- perform validation based on batchType: /* 1. The card number OR account info fields need to have a value. 2. If the card number is not null then the card expiration date needs to be not null. 3. If the card expiration date is not null then the card number needs to be not null 4. If the Account info has a value, then the card number and/or card expiration fields need to be null. */
--decline reason is required no matter what batch type: if (@DECLINEREASON is null or @DECLINEREASON = '') RAISERROR ('Decline reason is required.', 16, 1)
if lower(@BATCHTYPE) = 'direct debit' begin --Direct Debit if (@ACCOUNTINFO is null or @ACCOUNTINFO = '') RAISERROR ('Please enter the Account Info for a Direct Debit decline.', 16, 1)
-- set the credit card fields to NULL before saving? *OR* just do two different updates??? set @CARDHOLDERNAME = ''; set @CARDNUMBER = ''; set @CARDEXPIRATION = ''; end else begin --Credit Card if (@CARDNUMBER is null or @CARDNUMBER = '') RAISERROR ('Card number is required for a Credit Card decline.', 16, 1)
--an empty fuzzy date value is: 00000000 if (@CARDEXPIRATION is null or @CARDEXPIRATION = '' or @CARDEXPIRATION = '00000000') RAISERROR ('Card expiration is required if there is a Credit Card number, for a Credit Card decline.', 16, 1)
--check for cardholder if (@CARDHOLDERNAME is null or @CARDHOLDERNAME = '') RAISERROR ('Card holder name is required for a Credit Card decline.', 16, 1)
set @ACCOUNTINFO = ''; end
-- handle updating the data update dbo.USR_EFTDECLINE_BATCH_SPONSORS set CARDHOLDERNAME = @CARDHOLDERNAME, --@BATCHDATE = BATCHDATE, DECLINEREASON = @DECLINEREASON, CARDNUMBER = @CARDNUMBER, CARDEXPIRATION = @CARDEXPIRATION, ACCOUNTINFO = @ACCOUNTINFO, --@BATCHNUMBER = USR_EFTDECLINE_BATCH_SPONSORS.BATCHNUMBER, --@CHILDINFO = CHILDINFO, --@REVENUELOOKUPID = REVENUELOOKUPID CHANGEDBYID = @CHANGEAGENTID, DATECHANGED = @CURRENTDATE where ID = @ID end try
begin catch exec dbo.USP_RAISE_ERROR return 1 end catch
return 0;
